intro: Dichapetalum peekelii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a deciduous shrub that produces large, fragrant white flowers at night, which open only during the evening. The flowers have a unique structure with two large petals and numerous stamens, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water. It is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
